page.title: 08Motorway Survey
page.content: The M56, one of the major access roads into North Wales runs through our area. It is a mojor factor in attracting companies into the new towns. There is a junction with the M6 6 miles away to the east. If you follow the M6 south you will evetually come to Birmingham. If you go north you will come to Carlisle and Scotland. If you travel East on the M56 you can join up with the M63 and M62, joining Lancashire to Yorkshire. This junction also gives easy entry to Manchester. { { TRAFFIC SURVEY { 37% were lorries 18% were vans 3% were motorbikes 42% were cars
